result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert John La Rock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant can transfer jail to Iron County Jail.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert John La Rock

records.addlTxt:
Waiver of Prelim - 10/24/22 at 2:50 p.m.

Return to sender, insufficient address, unable to forward.

2:52 p.m. 
Clerk Micki.

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person, with Attorney Daniel Johns Jr. 

Waiver of Prelim. Arraignment. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

Waiver of Prelim. filed; COURT questions deft as to waiver.
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information will be e-filed; Reading Waived; R/J. 

PLEA to: 
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping - Felony >> GUILTY.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 10 days MCJ; 30 days to report to jail; Can transfer jail to Iron County Jail; DNA sample and surcharge; and CC. 3 days jail credit. 

Adj: 3:06 p.m.
Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief
Waiver of Prelim on October 24, 2022 at 02:50 pm.

State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence; Attorney Johns appears by phone
DATES: 
10/24/22 will be Waiver of Prelim, Arraignment and Plea

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.

- No contact with victim(s): Gazebo in Big Bull Falls park. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
- Absolute sobriety from, and no possession of alcohol. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  715-476-2112
